p: Node rank was the number of infective link(s) that intersected each epidemic node, where ‘rank 1’ identified the node crossed by the largest number of infective links and ‘rank n’ was the node crossed by the smallest number of such links. It was assumed that all infective links were available from day 1 onward [57]. Therefore, node degrees were assessed with indicators that estimated short- and long-range connectivity: road segments and infective links, respectively.
